data.question: What is the DOI for the International Edition of the article?
What transformation is enabled by the rare-earth ate complex according to the article?
data.answer: Catalytic Selective Dihydrosilylation of Internal Alkynes

data.question: Which rare-earth ate complex proved to be the ideal catalyst for dihydrosilylation of internal alkynes?
True or False: The yttrium and samarium alkyl and samarium bis(amido) ate complexes exhibited high activity and selectivity for dihydrosilylation of internal alkynes.
What was the yield percentage for the preparation of the lanthanum iodide LLaI(THF)2 (1)?
What was the main challenge in catalytic dihydrosilylation of alkynes mentioned in the article?
data.answer: The difficulty in the hydrosilylation of the resulting vinylsilanes and the control of the two-step regioselectivity

data.question: True or False: The lanthanum bis(amido) ate complex was found to be ineffective for the dihydrosilylation of internal alkynes.
What was the conversion percentage of alkyne in the model reaction using the yttrium alkyl YC catalyst?

True or False: The reaction conditions for the dihydrosilylation of 1-propynylbenzene were optimized to achieve a 98% yield of the dihydrosilylation product using the lanthanum bis(amido) ate complex.
What effect did lowering the reaction temperature to 40 88C have on the dihydrosilylation reaction efficiency?
data.answer: It mainly led to the monohydrosilylation product, indicating significant temperature effects on the reaction efficiency.

data.question: True or False: The dihydrosilylation of alkynes featuring a long alkyl chain yielded the dihydrosilylation products smoothly in poor yields.
What was the outcome of the stoichiometric reaction of the lanthanum bis(amido) ate complex 3 with nC6H13SiH3?
data.answer: The formation of the dinuclear complex KLLa(m-H)2[m-N-(SiMe3)Me2SiCH2]La(THF)LK (10) as red crystals in high yield.

data.question: True or False: The catalytic behavior of the dinuclear complex was inferior to that of the lanthanum bis(amido) ate complex for the dihydrosilylation of internal alkynes.
What was the main reason for the high activity of the lanthanum bis(amido) ate complex in the dihydrosilylation of internal alkynes?
data.answer: The anionic nature of the catalyst and the large lanthanum ion facilitated the s-bond metathesis with hydrosilanes to form active rare-earth hydride intermediates.

data.question: True or False: The article reports on the first successful dihydrosilylation of internal alkynes with an ene-diamido lanthanum ate complex as a catalyst.
What was the main factor considered to achieve satisfactory dihydrosilylation according to the article?
data.answer: The effects of the ionic radii of rare-earth ions were considered.

data.question: True or False: The structural analysis of the lanthanum bis(amido) ate complex revealed a monomeric structure.
What was the main challenge in the synthesis of geminal bis- and tris(silanes) mentioned in the article?
data.answer: The efficient synthesis of these classes of silanes is still a challenge due to very limited substrate scope and low efficiency.

data.question: True or False: The article mentions that organosilanes are not important intermediates in the synthesis of valuable silicon materials.
What was the yield of the lanthanum amido complexes LLaN(SiMe3)2(THF) (2) and bis(amido) ate complex KLLa(N-(SiMe3)2)2 (3)?
